00021 #ifndef KC_TREE_H
00022 #define KC_TREE_H
00023 
00024 #include "KMeans.h"                // all k-means includes
00025 #include "KCutil.h"                // kc-tree utilities

00027 class KMfilterCenters;                // see KMfilterCenters.h
00028 
00029 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00030 //  kc-tree - the k-center tree.
00031 //    This is a stripped-down modification of the kd-tree of the ANN
00032 //    library (see ann/include/ANN/ANN.h and ann/src/kd_tree.h).
00033 //    There are a number of technical difficulties in attempting to
00034 //    design this structure through inheritance.)  The main difference
00035 //    is that we do not support nearest neighbor searching, but
00036 //    instead support an operation (getNeighbors) which given a set of
00037 //    center points, computes the subset of data points in the tree
00038 //    that is closest to each center.
00039 //
00040 //    In addition to the kd-tree information, the nodes of the kc-tree
00041 //    also store the number of data points associated with each node
00042 //    of the tree and they keep an associated sum and sums of squares
00043 //    for these points.  There are also a few 'hooks' inserted for
00044 //    the eventual goal of extending this to a dynamic structure.
00045 //
00046 //    The tree is constructed in three phases.  The first phase is
00047 //    borrowed from the ANN library, and builds the kc-tree for the
00048 //    data points.  The second phase computes sum and sum of squares
00049 //    for each node, by a simple postorder tree traversal.  The third
00050 //    phase (which may be repeated) is given a set of centers, and
00051 //    computes the candidates for each node in the tree.
00052 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00053 class KCnode;
00054 typedef KCnode    *KCptr;            // pointer to kc-node
00055 
00056 class KCtree {
00057 protected:
00058     int            dim;        // dimension of space
00059     int            n_pts;        // number of points in tree
00060     int            max_pts;    // max number of points in tree
00061     KMdataArray        pts;        // the points (of size max(n,m_max))
00062     KMdatIdxArray    pidx;        // point indices (to pts)
00063     KCptr        root;        // root of kc-tree
00064     KMorthRect        bnd_box;    // bounding box
00065 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00066 //  Protected utilities
00067 //      skeletonTree    Initializes the basic tree elements (without
00068 //              building the tree).
00069 //      builtKc_tree    Recursive utility that actually builds the
00070 //              kc-tree from a set of points.
00071 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00072     void skeletonTree(            // construct skeleton tree
00073     KMdataArray    pa,        // point array (with at least n pts)
00074     int        n,        // number of points
00075     int        dd,        // dimension
00076     int        n_max,        // maximum number of points (optional)
00077     KMpoint        bb_lo,        // bounding box low point (optional)
00078     KMpoint        bb_hi,        // bounding box high point (optional)
00079     KMdatIdxArray    pi);        // point indices (optional)
00080 
00081     KCptr buildKcTree(            // recursive construction of kc-tree
00082     KMdataArray    pa,        // point array
00083     KMdatIdxArray    pidx,        // point indices to store in subtree
00084     int        n,        // number of points
00085     int        dim,        // dimension of space
00086     KMorthRect    &bnd_box);    // bounding box for current node
00087 
00088 public:
00089     KCtree(                // build from point array
00090     KMdataArray    pa,            // point array
00091     int        n,            // number of points
00092     int        dd,            // dimension
00093     int        n_max = 0,        // max num of points (def = n)
00094     KMpoint        bb_lo = NULL,        // bounding box low point
00095     KMpoint        bb_hi = NULL);        // bounding box high point
00096 
00097                         // compute neighbors for centers
00098     void getNeighbors(KMfilterCenters& ctrs);
00099 
00100     void getAssignments(        // compute assignments for points
00101     KMfilterCenters&    ctrs,        // the current centers
00102     KMctrIdxArray         closeCtr,        // closest center per point
00103     double*             sqDist);        // sq'd distance to center
00104 
00105     ~KCtree();                // tree destructor
00106 
00107     void sampleCtr(KMpoint c);        // sample a center point c
00108 
00109     void print(                // print the tree (for debugging)
00110     bool with_pts);                // print points as well?
00111 };
00112 
00113 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00114 //  Generic kc-tree node
00115 //    Nodes in kc-trees are of two types, splitting nodes which contain
00116 //    splitting information (a splitting hyperplane orthogonal to one
00117 //    of the coordinate axes) and leaf nodes which contain point
00118 //    information (an array of points stored in a bucket).  This is
00119 //    handled by making a generic class kc-node.  The kc-node contains
00120 //    the following basic information.
00121 //
00122 //        n_data        The number of data points associated
00123 //                with this node.
00124 //        sum        This is the sum of points (i.e., the
00125 //                weighted centroid) of all the points
00126 //                associated with this node.
00127 //        sumSq        This is the sum of squares (i.e., the
00128 //                sum of the dot products of each point
00129 //                with itself).
00130 //        bnd_box        Bounding box for the cell.
00131 //
00132 //    NOTE: The constructor does no (interesting) initialization.
00133 //    This is handled in getSums().
00134 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00135 
00136 class KCnode {            // generic kc-tree node
00137 protected:
00138     const int        multCand;    // multiple candidate flag
00139     int            n_data;        // number of data points
00140     KMpoint        sum;        // sum of points
00141     double        sumSq;        // sum of squares
00142     KMorthRect        bnd_box;    // bounding box for cell
00143 public:
00144     KCnode(                // basic constructor
00145     int        dim,        // dimension
00146     KMorthRect    &bb)        // bounding box
00147     : multCand(-1), bnd_box(dim, bb)// create bounding box
00148     {  sum = kmAllocPt(dim, 0); sumSq = 0; }
00149         
00150     virtual ~KCnode();        // destructor
00151 
00152     void cellMidpt(KMpoint pt);        // get cell's midpoint (pt modified)
00153 
00154     KMorthRect &bndBox()        // get cell's bounding box
00155     {  return bnd_box;  }
00156 
00157     virtual void makeSums(        // compute sums of points
00158     int        &n,            // number of points (returned)
00159     KMpoint        &theSum,        // sum (returned)
00160     double        &theSumSq) = 0;        // sum of squares (returned)
00161 
00162     virtual void getNeighbors(        // compute neighbors for centers
00163     KMctrIdxArray    cands,            // candidate centers
00164     int        kCands) = 0;        // number of centers
00165 
00166     virtual void getAssignments(    // get assignments for leaf node
00167     KMctrIdxArray    cands,            // candidate centers
00168     int        kCands,            // number of centers
00169     KMctrIdxArray     closeCtr,        // closest center per point
00170     double*         sqDist) = 0;        // sq'd distance to center
00171 
00172                     // sample a center point c
00173     virtual void sampleCtr(KMpoint c, KMorthRect& bb) = 0;
00174                         //
00175     virtual void print(int level) = 0;    // print node
00176 
00177     int n_nodes()            // number of nodes in this subtree
00178     { return 2*n_data - 1; }            // this assumes bucket size=1!
00179 
00180     friend class KCtree;            // allow kc-tree to access us
00181 };
00182 
00183 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00184 //  Leaf kc-tree node
00185 //    Leaf nodes of the kc-tree store the set of points associated
00186 //    with this bucket, stored as an array of point indices.  These
00187 //    are indices in the array points, which resides with the
00188 //    root of the kc-tree.  We also store the number of points
00189 //    that reside in this bucket.
00190 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00191 
00192 class KCleaf: public KCnode
00193 {
00194 protected:
00195     KMidxArray        bkt;        // bucket of points
00196 public:
00197     KCleaf(                // constructor
00198     int        dim,        // dimension
00199     KMorthRect    &bb,        // bounding box
00200     int        n,        // number of points
00201     KMdatIdxArray    b)        // the bucket
00202     : KCnode(dim, bb)        // create kc-node
00203     {  assert(n <= 1);  n_data = n;  bkt = b;  }
00204         
00205     virtual ~KCleaf() {}        // destructor (none)
00206 
00207     KMpoint getPoint();            // get data point
00208 
00209     virtual void makeSums(        // compute sums
00210     int        &n,            // number of points (returned)
00211     KMpoint        &theSum,        // sum (returned)
00212     double        &theSumSq);        // sum of squares (returned)
00213 
00214     virtual void getNeighbors(        // compute neighbors for centers
00215     KMctrIdxArray    cands,            // candidate centers
00216     int        kCands);        // number of centers
00217 
00218     virtual void getAssignments(    // get assignments for leaf node
00219     KMctrIdxArray    cands,            // candidate centers
00220     int        kCands,            // number of centers
00221     KMctrIdxArray     closeCtr,        // closest center per point
00222     double*         sqDist);        // sq'd distance to center
00223 
00224                     // sample a center point c
00225     virtual void sampleCtr(KMpoint c, KMorthRect& bb);
00226 
00227                     // print node
00228     virtual void print(int level);
00229 };
00230 
00231 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00232 //  kc-tree splitting node.
00233 //    Splitting nodes contain a cutting dimension and a cutting value.
00234 //    These indicate the axis-parellel plane which subdivide the
00235 //    box for this node.  The extent of the bounding box along the
00236 //    cutting dimension is maintained (this is used to speed up point
00237 //    to box distance calculations) [we do not store the entire bounding
00238 //    box since this may be wasteful of space in high dimensions].
00239 //    We also store pointers to the 2 children.
00240 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00241 
00242 class KCsplit : public KCnode    // splitting node of a kc-tree
00243 {
00244 protected:
00245     int            cut_dim;    // dim orthogonal to cutting plane
00246     KMcoord        cut_val;    // location of cutting plane
00247     KMcoord        cd_bnds[2];    // lower and upper bounds of
00248                     // rectangle along cut_dim
00249     KCptr        child[2];    // left and right children
00250 public:
00251     KCsplit(                // constructor
00252     int dim,                // cutting dimension
00253     KMorthRect &bb,                // bounding box
00254     int cd,                    // cutting dimension
00255     KMcoord cv,                // cutting value
00256     KMcoord lv, KMcoord hv,            // low and high values
00257     KCptr lc=NULL, KCptr hc=NULL)        // children
00258     : KCnode(dim, bb)            // create kc-node
00259     {
00260         cut_dim    = cd;            // cutting dimension
00261         cut_val    = cv;            // cutting value
00262         cd_bnds[KM_LO] = lv;        // lower bound for rectangle
00263         cd_bnds[KM_HI] = hv;        // upper bound for rectangle
00264         child[KM_LO] = lc;            // left child
00265         child[KM_HI] = hc;            // right child
00266     }
00267 
00268     virtual ~KCsplit()            // destructor
00269     {
00270         if (child[KM_LO] != NULL) delete child[KM_LO];
00271         if (child[KM_HI] != NULL) delete child[KM_HI];
00272     }
00273 
00274     virtual void makeSums(    // compute sums
00275     int        &n,            // number of points (returned)
00276     KMpoint        &theSum,        // sum (returned)
00277     double        &theSumSq);        // sum of squares (returned)
00278 
00279     virtual void getNeighbors(        // compute neighbors for centers
00280     KMctrIdxArray    cands,            // candidate centers
00281     int        kCands);        // number of centers
00282 
00283     virtual void getAssignments(    // get assignments for leaf node
00284     KMctrIdxArray    cands,            // candidate centers
00285     int        kCands,            // number of centers
00286     KMctrIdxArray     closeCtr,        // closest center per point
00287     double*         sqDist);        // sq'd distance to center
00288 
00289                     // sample a center point c
00290     virtual void sampleCtr(KMpoint c, KMorthRect& bb);
00291 
00292                     // print node
00293     virtual void print(int level);
00294 };
00295 
00296 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00297 //  kc-splitting function:
00298 //    kd_splitter is a pointer to a splitting procedure for preprocessing.
00299 //    Different splitting procedures result in different strategies
00300 //    for building the tree.
00301 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00302 
00303 typedef void (*KMkd_splitter)(        // splitting procedure for kd-trees
00304     KMpointArray    pa,        // point array (unaltered)
00305     KMidxArray        pidx,        // point indices (permuted on return)
00306     const KMorthRect    &bnds,        // bounding rectangle for cell
00307     int            n,        // number of points
00308     int            dim,        // dimension of space
00309     int            &cut_dim,    // cutting dimension (returned)
00310     KMcoord        &cut_val,    // cutting value (returned)
00311     int            &n_lo);        // num of points on low side (returned)
00312 
00313 #endif
